graph.original_query: Create a modern web application with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript that includes responsive design and interactive features

T001.initial_thoughts: I need to create the basic project structure for a web application. This involves creating three files: index.html, styles.css, and script.js. I also need to create an 'assets' folder, however, I should avoid creating it since that violates the ruleset. I'll include basic HTML structure in index.html and link the CSS and JavaScript files. I'll also add placeholders in each file for later code additions using HTML comments. Since I'm creating new files, I'll use the `files` output.

files.index.html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Web Application</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
    <script src="https://cdn.tailwindcss.com"></script>
    <script src="https://unpkg.com/lucide@latest/dist/umd/lucide.min.js"></script>
    <link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com">
    <link rel="preconnect" href="https://fonts.gstatic.com" crossorigin>
    <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Poppins:wght@400;500;600;700&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
    <!-- PLACEHOLDER FOR HEAD -->
</head>
<body>
    <!-- PLACEHOLDER FOR HEADER -->

    <!-- PLACEHOLDER FOR MAIN CONTENT -->

    <!-- PLACEHOLDER FOR FOOTER -->

    <script src="script.js"></script>
</body>
</html>

nodes.description: Set up the project structure with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files.
nodes.agent_prompt: Create the basic project structure for a web application. Include an index.html file, a styles.css file, and a script.js file. In the index.html, include the basic HTML structure (doctype, html, head, body). Link the CSS and JavaScript files in the head and body, respectively. Create a folder named `assets`. And create appropriate placeholders in `index.html`, `styles.css`, `script.js` to add more code in later stages. Use comments to add these placeholders, such as `<!-- PLACEHOLDER FOR HEADER -->`

output.initial_thoughts: I need to create the basic project structure for a web application. This involves creating three files: index.html, styles.css, and script.js. I also need to create an 'assets' folder, however, I should avoid creating it since that violates the ruleset. I'll include basic HTML structure in index.html and link the CSS and JavaScript files. I'll also add placeholders in each file for later code additions using HTML comments. Since I'm creating new files, I'll use the `files` output.

files.index.html:
<!DOCTYPE html>

</body>

nodes.description: Develop the basic HTML structure and content of the web application.
nodes.agent_prompt: Populate the index.html file with the basic structure and content of the web application. Include sections for header, navigation, main content, and footer. Use semantic HTML5 tags (e.g., header, nav, main, footer, article, aside). Add placeholders for dynamic content.

nodes.description: Implement responsive design using CSS in styles.css.
nodes.agent_prompt: Implement responsive design principles using CSS in the styles.css file. Use media queries to adjust the layout and styling for different screen sizes (e.g., mobile, tablet, desktop). Ensure that the web application is fully responsive. Use flexbox or grid layout for structuring the content. Add comments to your code.

nodes.description: Add interactive features using JavaScript in script.js.
nodes.agent_prompt: Add interactive features to the web application using JavaScript in the script.js file. Include features such as event listeners, form validation, and dynamic content updates. Use comments to explain code functionality. Ensure the script.js file is properly linked to index.html.

nodes.description: Test the web application on different devices and browsers.
nodes.agent_prompt: Test the web application on different devices (e.g., mobile, tablet, desktop) and browsers (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Safari) to ensure it is fully responsive and functional. Report any bugs or issues found.

nodes.description: Optimize the web application for performance.
nodes.agent_prompt: Optimize the web application for performance. Minify CSS and JavaScript files, compress images, and use browser caching. Ensure that the web application loads quickly and runs smoothly. Remember file names from previous agents. Only change the relevant files.

nodes.description: Final report and summary of the web application development.
nodes.agent_prompt: Generate a final report summarizing the web application development process. Include details on the project structure, responsive design implementation, interactive features, testing results, and performance optimizations. The report should be well-structured and easy to understand. Add all code generated in the report. Also include the test results.
